name: Lysandra, the Shadow Initiate (Dhampir Wizard)

specials.name: Blood Drain
specials.description: Effect: Lysandra makes a melee Strike with her fangs. If the attack hits and deals damage, she regains Hit Points equal to half the damage dealt.

specials.name: Shadow Step
specials.description: Effect: Lysandra teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space she can see that is in dim light or darkness.

specials.name: Necrotic Aura
specials.description: Effect: Lysandra emits a 20-foot-radius aura of necrotic energy. Creatures in the area must succeed at a DC 18 Fortitude save or take 2d6 negative damage and become enfeebled 1 for 1 minute.

specials.name: Shield
specials.description:
Trigger: Lysandra is targeted by an attack.
Effect: She gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

description:
As the mortal offspring of a vampire and a living parent, dhampirs occupy an unusual place among the living. Their vampiric parentage lends them elongated incisors, an unearthly beauty and physical grace, ghostly pallor, and a piercing gaze. Perhaps their most distinctive feature, however, is their connection to energy from the Void, which heals them, leaving them as vulnerable to life energy as any undead creature. Though they don't suffer the full range of a vampire's vulnerabilities, they do share certain characteristics with their vampire parent, leading to several distinct dhampir heritages across Golarion. By far the most common dhampirs are svetochers, the children of the more common moroi vampires.

Many dhampirs grow up as orphans because their mortal parent perished as a result of a difficult childbirth, or else they believed their child to be cursed and abandoned them. Often outcast, some dhampirs leverage their charisma and personal magnetism to manipulate those around them, while others struggle to form even basic relationships. Mistrust of a dhampir's ancestry presents further challenges when dhampirs attempt to integrate into mortal society. Those who seek out their vampiric parent often find themselves judged as inferior, rejected as they were by mortals but for different reasons.

Dhampirs fill countless roles within many communities. Some prefer to blend in as best they can, holding regular jobs and building families (most children born to dhampirs share an ancestry with the dhampir's mortal parent, but a rare few are born as dhampirs themselves). Those who learn to make the most of their inherited charm can achieve high societal status, whether leveraging traditional avenues of power or gathering followers enamored by the dhampir's abilities. With a lifespan rivaling that of an elf, a dhampir can develop extensive influence and engage in long-reaching schemes of massive scope. Further, their ancestry lends them a proclivity to necromancy and the occult arts.

Lysandra was once a wizard seeking to expand her knowledge for the purpose of further empowering her clan of vampires. Her adventures brought her to the Everchanging Labyrinth. She descended down into the dungeons with a bloodlust for power, however, the Labyrinth powers proved to be too powerful. Now she serves as the perpetually scours the dungeons, seeking more would to be victims of the Labyrinth.

Recall Knowledge - Humanoid (Society): DC 16
Unspecific Lore: DC 14
Specific Lore: DC 11

**Tactics**
*Opening Moves* Casts Mage Armor before combat and uses Necrotic Pulse to soften enemies.
*Combat Strategy* Focuses on ranged attacks with Ray of Frost and Magic Missile, using Shadow Step to avoid melee threats.
*Defense* Utilizes Arcane Shield and dimly lit areas to minimize damage
items: dagger, spellbook containing their prepared spells, staff
savenote: +2 circumstance to all saves vs. disease
spells: Detect Magic, Light, Mage Hand, Ray of Frost, Shield
